newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish princess to wed in Barcelona's Cathedral.
newsitem.headline: Spanish princess to wed in Barcelona's Cathedral.

text.p: Spain's Princess Cristina, the youngest daughter of King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia, has chosen Barcelona's great Gothic Cathedral for her October wedding, the royal palace announced on Friday.

The 31-year-old princess, third in line to the throne, plans to marry Olympic handball player Inaki Urdangarin on October 4, a date set by the palace earlier in May. They will have a lunch reception afterward at the lavish Royal Palace of Pedralbes.
The couple, who met at the Atlanta Olympic Games where Spain's handball team won a bronze medal, both live and work in Barcelona, making the Catalan costal city a natural choice for the wedding site.

The 550-year-old Cathedral, located in the heart of the city's old quarter, is one of the grandest of Spain's Gothic buildings and for some quirky reason has always had a flock of white geese living in its cloistered gardens.
Cristina, like her unmarried younger brother, Crown Prince Felipe, and her elder sister Elena, is beloved by the Spanish public for her unpretentious and low-key style.
But the wedding promises to be a glittering affair.
When Elena got married in the southern city of Seville two years ago, royals from all over the world attended and it was broadcast on television to 400 million viewers.
